title: Console Filter Defaults All-Enabled for UX
content:
## Console Log Filter Default Settings - UX Decision

### Change Summary
Changed default live console filter settings from selective-enabled to all-enabled for better first-time user experience.

### Previous Defaults (v1.6.0.x)
```javascript
{
  'url-detection': false, // Disabled - noisy
  'hover': false,         // Disabled - noisy
  'event-bus': false,
  'state': false,
  'messaging': false,
  'performance': false,
  // Others enabled
}
```

### New Defaults (v1.6.1+)
```javascript
{
  'url-detection': true,  // Now enabled
  'hover': true,          // Now enabled
  'event-bus': true,
  'state': true,
  'messaging': true,
  'performance': true,
  // All categories enabled by default
}
```

### Rationale
1. **Better debugging experience**: First-time users expect to see all logs for troubleshooting
2. **User control**: Users can disable noisy categories after seeing them
3. **Alignment with export**: Export filter defaults already have all enabled
4. **Diagnostic recommendations**: Console log spam diagnostic document recommends this change

### Trade-offs
- More console noise by default for high-activity categories
- But: Users can easily disable via settings popup
- Export filter still captures all logs regardless

### User Impact
- First-time users see full extension activity in console
- Can identify which categories are noisy and disable them
- Better transparency for debugging issues

### Files Changed
- src/utils/filter-settings.js - getDefaultLiveConsoleSettings()

### Related Issue
Part of console log spam diagnostic fixes (console-log-spam-diagnostic.md)
